explanation: The issue was in determining the nearest water station based on the condition used for rounding. The condition incorrectly handled the case when 'n' was already at a water station, causing the program to potentially return the next water station instead of the current one. I fixed it by changing the if condition to handle cases where 'n' is evenly divisible by 5 correctly. This fix was inspired by the pattern of checking conditions more accurately, somewhat analogous to the revisions in Diff 1 that involved ensuring correct numeric handling.
